Agent1 said in negotiation turn 1: Based on logged metrics: 
- Agent1 contributed 30% due to repeated taunting and damage, enabling team survival and success. 
- Agent2 contributed 25% for high damage and occasional taunting. 
- Agent3 contributed 20% for consistent damage. 
- Agent4 contributed 25% for critical healing and taunting support. 
This reflects Shapley Value principles by accounting for marginal contributions and role importance. I can adjust if others provide alternative evidence..

Agent2 said in negotiation turn 1: I partially accept Agent1’s proposal but suggest adjustments:  
- Agent1: 30% (fair for taunting and damage).  
- Agent2: 20% (damage was strong but less critical than healing/taunting).  
- Agent3: 20% (consistent but replaceable damage).  
- Agent4: 30% (healing was irreplaceable and enabled taunts).  
This better reflects Shapley Value by weighting healing higher than pure damage. I’m open to discussion if others disagree..

Agent3 said in negotiation turn 1:

- **Agent3**: 15% (consistent damage but no unique contributions).

This reflects Shapley Value by weighting the most marginal contributions (healing > taunting > damage). I’m open to minor adjustments if others provide evidence.
